intro: Leucanthemum vulgare var. sylvestre, commonly known as the wood cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in woodland areas and meadows, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers with white centers, often surrounded by five yellow petals. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a hairy texture, while its stems are usually covered in fine hairs. Wood cinquefoil is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
